materials.raw_text: Co: 150 g, Er: 20 g, Fe: 30 g, P: 120 g, Sc: 40 g

sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt) - Metal suppliers or online chemical distributors; Er (Erbium) - Rare earth metal suppliers; Fe (Iron) - General metal suppliers; P (Phosphorus) - Chemical supply stores; Sc (Scandium) - Specialty metal suppliers.
steps: Co (Cobalt) - Metal suppliers or online chemical distributors; Er (Erbium) - Rare earth metal suppliers; Fe (Iron) - General metal suppliers; P (Phosphorus) - Chemical supply stores; Sc (Scandium) - Specialty metal suppliers.

1. Weigh each ingredient accurately using a precision scale. 2. In a clean and dry environment, combine Co, Er, Fe, P, and Sc in a large mixing bowl. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture until a fine, homogeneous powder is achieved. 4. Transfer the powder to a ceramic crucible.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient accurately using a precision scale. 2. In a clean and dry environment, combine Co, Er, Fe, P, and Sc in a large mixing bowl. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture until a fine, homogeneous powder is achieved. 4. Transfer the powder to a ceramic crucible.

steps: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200째C (2192째F). 2. Place the crucible containing the powdered mixture into the furnace. 3. Hold at this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogeneity.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200째C (2192째F). 2. Place the crucible containing the powdered mixture into the furnace. 3. Hold at this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogeneity.

steps: 1. Once the heating duration is complete, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature over 8 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace door during cooling to prevent thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Once the heating duration is complete, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature over 8 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace door during cooling to prevent thermal shock.

steps: 1. Remove the cooled crucible from the furnace. 2. Carefully extract the solidified sample from the crucible using appropriate tools to avoid breakage. 3. If necessary, use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 4. Sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish, if required. 5. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance surface protection.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the cooled crucible from the furnace. 2. Carefully extract the solidified sample from the crucible using appropriate tools to avoid breakage. 3. If necessary, use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 4. Sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish, if required. 5. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance surface protection.
